alert.note: Alert for Letcher; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 5:55PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Letcher and Perry. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 555 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vicco, Blackey, Hallie, Bluefield, Red Star, Ulvah, Banks, Elko, Arminta, Lilley Cornett Woods, Cornettsville, Skyline, Defeated Creek, Roxana, Flint, Linefork, Kings Creek and Jeff.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
